events.description: A group of seven warriors, including the Ashes, Fire, Bladder, Grasshopper, Dragon Fly, Fish, and Turtle, set out to make war, but their enthusiasm is disrupted when a wind blows the Ashes away. The remaining six continue on, with the Fire leading the way until it reaches a river and disappears, leaving the five warriors to continue without it.

The Bladder, who had been sneering at his companions, decides to rise above them and goes upward among the tree-tops but is pricked by a thorn apple and falls to his death. The four remaining warriors do not turn back, but instead press on to make war.

As they journey through a great wood, the Grasshopper's legs get stuck in the mud, and he pulls them off, unable to continue fighting. His cousin, the Dragon Fly, weeps for him and continues on, eventually losing his head when it blows out of his body due to excessive crying.

The Fish, who has been observing from a distance, decides that the remaining warriors are not fit for battle and suggests continuing on without them. The Fish and the Turtle come upon a large camp ground where they encounter the people of a round village of teepees.

The villagers, curious about the two strange warriors, ask what they seek, but the Fish's peculiar speech confuses them. Witty old Iktomi steps forward to translate, revealing that the Fish has said 'Zuya unhipi! We come to make war!'
The villagers are outraged and decide to kill the Fish and the Turtle, but the two warriors warn them of impending trouble if they proceed with their plan.

Despite the warnings, the villagers go ahead and build a fire to boil the Fish and the Turtle. However, the Fish suddenly blows water all over the people, scalding many and causing them to flee in pain.

The people, realizing that they have made a grave mistake, decide to carry the Fish and the Turtle to the lake of muddy water to drown them. The two warriors then dive into the mud, revealing their true nature as inhabitants of the lake.

The villagers are shocked and frightened by this revelation and realize that they will be punished for their actions. A wise chief suggests summoning Iya, the Eater, who is capable of swallowing entire lakes.

Iktomi, who had been swallowed by Iya earlier, uses his location within the Eater's stomach to guide the villagers in bringing him to the lake. The Fish and the Turtle then dive into the mud as Iya drinks the water from the lake.

The people realize that they have made a terrible mistake and cry out in despair as Iktomi strikes his knife upward, causing the water within Iya's stomach to fall back down to the earth, drowning the villagers.
With the villagers defeated, the Fish and the Turtle emerge victorious, painted and singing triumphantly. They return home to celebrate their victory.
